author: fhilip.k
title: Japanese Voter Survey - AIM
description: Специфическая для Японии информация о том, как избиратели взаимодействуют с Catalyst, недостаточно хорошо изучена, необходимо сосредоточиться на обеспечении вовлечения избирателей.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal addresses a well-known issue - voters engagement for japan Community 
If implemented ,the community would have the data to better understand how to increase voter engagement in that region. This will in turn impact positively the ecosystem
f6_assessments.q1:
Relevant experience  matches the objectives as the project. Having a Japanese translator with a deep understanding of the Cardano Japan community increases the feasibility.
Prior work on the same  problem suggests highly feasibility . The survey tool  is already developed
f6_assessments.q2: I have checked the budget of the past Incentivized Voter Survey - AIM funded proposal , Budget seem fair and the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Great proposal, By lending a listening ear to the Japanese community you provide a structure where Japan can be heard and listened to. This will help the Japanese community tremendously and help them feel welcome in the ecosystem. With the results of the survey, this proposal is able to scale up and help where adjustments need to be done.
f6_assessments.q1: The team needs no introduction within the Catalyst group, they already provide the community with tools that help us assess the proposals and make our lives not a living hell. The proposer team exists of Community advisors to financial advisors, which gives great confidence that this proposal will be a success if implemented. The roadmap provided gives meaningful insight into how this proposal will come to life and how the team will handle it.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal gives all the necessary information for auditability. The KPI's that are given in the proposal are in-line with the proposal and provide details on how this proposal can improve in later funding rounds. Since results will be announced everyone in the community can look into them.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal actually engages numerous Challenge settings from 'Community Events' to this specific Challenge. It has a sole focus on understanding the behavior of voters from Japan. In order to achieve this 2 (two) key things need to happen. Collaboration with a Japanese community member to provide translation and secondly to also entice engagement, which they have done. One beautiful, critical and worthy note that needs to be put on the spotlight is their mission, distributed governance. Seeing that a prominent Japanese representative who is also deeply entrenched in Cardano is also involved in this proposal, shows with out a doubt the unbias and fair spirit behind this proposal. This proposals statement, '... avoid a few members of the community exercising an excessive amount of control over the process.' is implying something that only the proposers and in-the-loop individuals know of. And to bravely clamp down on this is truly decentralized. This is a proposal that needs to be funded not only because it fits numerous Challenge settings, it clearly strengthens the core principals of Cardano. The template that comes out of this proposal can be duplicated to other communities to build a database on voter behavior around the world.
f6_assessments.q1: The people behind this proposal are clearly stated in the proposal itself, although no links are provided to further verify these individuals, community members who have been active for a certain duration will know of these high value individuals. There is absolutely no doubt this proposal will be implemented successfully on the base of experience alone. Add to that their detailed budget where the majority of the items are adjoined with action plans and a time table that has been clearly though out, one feels that they are taken onto the journey of the development of this proposal. A great job! This is how a proposal should make people feel. Unfortunately though there is no mentioning of the risk and challenge, which perhaps stems from their successful experience in the first voter survey the Japanese representative once conducted.
f6_assessments.q2: Roadmap and milestones are crystal clear and equipped with clear action plans. Although not indicated specifically in its own section, there is a clear KPI that can measured. There is most likely to be no surprises here, making this proposal something to look forward when being audited by the auditors. Problem statement and solution are well thought out and interconnected. These factors usually pan out into a solid proposal, like this particular one.
f6_assessments.reply: I don't think that there's a requirement to identify by name, the person that will be paid for, nor It is indicated anywhere as a requirement, and if the proposal gets funded, the Catalyst Coordinator Process is where all the expenses gets reported and tracked, so again not a valid reason.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal wants to ensure the number of voters in Japan in the Catalyst community, which will greatly help in understanding the Japanese Community. By creating an incentive survey in Japanese for information about voters and allowing this information to support future Catalyst improvements.
There is clarity in the description of the problem and the solution presented, the proposal is suitable for the challenge. I completely agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge facing the developer ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal already has a working prototype, so there is no question that implementation of a solution is within the capabilities of the proposer. I feel this suggestion will succeed, as it has also been applied from Fund before and also for a very positive result. However, it will be great to know what about the contents of the surveys. By making a survey, you can provide sure information about the Japanese community, better understand how to add Japanese Cardano copper recognizes, understand and interact with Catalyst
	The proposer has provided experience but this info is not sustained with evidence. Describe quite complete and detailed about the team's experience and capacity, also put links to authenticate what team has made for the Catalyst community. Based on certain experiences of the proponent and plan Presentation, it is very likely that this proposal will be successfully implemented
	No challenges and risks are presented. Proposals have not considered challenges and risks related to successful implementation
f6_assessments.q2:
The stated budget is reasonable enough and it makes me completely agree that the team has enough capacity to tackle the challenge. The proposal provides indicators to determine success, but it is still a bit vague and there are no specific metrics to measure
It will be difficult to track the progress and success of this project as there is no launch date or roadmap with milestones provided.

f6_assessments.q0: I strongly agree the proposal is impactful. A survey about interaction between voters and Catalyst in Japanese will help us better understand about how the  Japanese Cardano community sees, understands and interacts with Catalyst. These information definitely benefit Catalyst as well as Cardano ecosystem to improve over time. Additionally, the proposal is able to scale to address future challenges (executing in another regions for example) because voters play an important role in our system.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is following the Incentivized voters survey which was successfully implementation in Fund6 (link included), now the team aims to update and translate it into Japanese, so that feasibility should not be a big deal. 
Since the Fund6 proposal was successful, I compare between budget of this proposal and budget of the previous one in details and my conclusion this proposal's finance is very reasonable to achieve the set goals. The updating content is more diverse about voters behaviour, looks promissing about a more successful result in the specific region survey.
Therefore, I trongly agree the proposal is feasible.
I recommend the team should consider challenge and risk relevant to the successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides roadmap with milestone and time horizon and time KPIs are outlined clearly, easy to see and easy to audit the progress of the implementation. 
I would like to know more clear about this: 'Fifty randomly-selected participants will receive $60 each. One respondent will receive $500'. So, is the $500 randomly also? Or any criterias for that?

solution: Создать стимулирующий опрос на японском языке, чтобы получить информацию об избирателях и использовать эту информацию для поддержки будущих улучшений Catalyst.
experience: Члены AIM являются командой, стоящей за созданием набора инструментов сообщества, сотрудничая с Yuta (японское сообщество) для перевода и распространения.
